Fields.DialogueText: Ha!
Whoa!
Oh! Watch out, sir!
Is this really a good place to play tennis, Dunkerque?
It's the only place, sir!

Fields.MenuText: Well, I suppose there isn't any room inside...
A warship is no place for tennis.
But you're taking up far too much space.

Fields.DialogueText: Exactly, sir!
I disagree, Capitaine. The open ocean, fresh salt air – what better companion could tennis have?
Don't worry, sir, we'll clean this up before any fighting starts.
Well, what about you, Lieutenant? What do you have to say for yourself?
Who am I to say no to the lady, sir?
Unbelievable. From now, tennis matches are banned on deck. I had thought that would have been assumed.
*ALARM*
What was that, Capitaine? I couldn't quite hear you.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Capitaine on the bridge!
Where are they?
Never mind - I see them. I hope you're ready for some exercise, Dunkerque.
Toujours!
@BATTLE
You know, Capitaine, I've been thinking.
Oh?
How much do you know about yachting?

Fields.MenuText: Only as much as any sailor would, I suppose.
Well, I wouldn't call myself an expert, but I know an amount befitting my status as an officer and a gentleperson.
Not a whole lot, I'm afraid.

Fields.DialogueText: Okay...
Oh, great!
That's too bad...
Why?
Well, I'm considering entering the Transpacific Yacht Race.
Is that something you could do?
Why wouldn't it be?
Um, no reason... never mind.
Where's Dunkerque?
She's up top, sir.
Nothing but me and the sparkling deep as far as the eye can see. Yarrrr...
Dunkerque!
Ah, to be free! To live upon the salty brine, brought hither and thither only upon the wind's whim!
DUNKERQUE!!
Oh! WHAT IS IT, CAPITAINE?
COULD YO– could you come down here, please?
Sure thing, sir. Wait, I just spotted something on the horizon! MORGANAS!
@BATTLE
Now, what was it you wanted to talk to me about, Capitaine?

Fields.MenuText: Forget about it. Were you talking to yourself?
It can wait. Let's make sure everything's in order after that battle.
Oh, yes. I'd like you to take a look at these reports...

Fields.DialogueText: What? No! Of course not. I was merely remarking upon the beauty of the sea.
Bien sûr, Capitaine!
Oh. Um. If you insist.
Dunkerque! I was wondering where you'd gotten to.
Ah, just getting this and that. What matters is that I have finally gotten to here!
You look... well, energetic. But that's hardly a surprise.
Are you ready to go fishing?

Fields.MenuText: Look at this mountain of paperwork in front of me, Dunkerque. What do you think?
Yes, just make sure we've got plenty of coffee.
I still can't believe I let you talk me into this.

Fields.DialogueText: Oh, don't be that way, sir.
Don't worry, sir, you were very clear about that.
Oh, come on! It'll be fun!
Oh, very well. Let's get going.
Here's your pole, sir.
When does the fishing start?
We're fishing right now, sir.
I'm not getting any bites.
Fishing isn't about getting bites, sir. It's about appreciating nature! It's about being outdoors! It's about the view.
It's so hazy outside. There's not much to see.
Well, then it's about appreciating the smell. Don't you love the salt air, sir?
I actually do, Dunkerque, but I also happen to be a captain of a naval vessel, and so am already offered with a multitude of opportunities to appreciate the salt air.
Well, you don't have to like fishing if you don't want to.
Morganas incoming!
Oh! They'll scare off all the fish...
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Did you get enough coffee before they arrived, Capitaine?
Enough coffee for what?
Not to be surly?
Not even close.
Excellent. The perfect targets await.
@BATTLE
That was a close one.
Oh, I don't know about that, sir. I felt like we had a handle on the situation.
Is that so? I'm afraid to see what you would consider a close one, then.
Ha! It's not likely to happen, sir.

Fields.MenuText: You sound so confident, Dunkerque.
I hope you're right.
We don't really know what the Morganas are capable of, though.

Fields.DialogueText: Well, I am, sir!
Of course I'm right, sir. No matter how bad this war gets, I'm confident we'll always come out on top.
Maybe not, but I'm confident I can handle any threat they pose!
Well, let me ask you this: How are you going to compete in a yacht race? You can't go more than ten yards from the ship.
I... hmmm...
You asked me how I would compete in a yacht race. Well, I think I've figured it out!
I'm going to ride in a yacht while the ship keeps pace a few yards away.
...That sounds incredibly dangerous.
War is incredibly dangerous, sir.

Fields.MenuText: But war is something we have to do. I don't think this is a good idea, Dunkerque.
There's dangerous, and there's stupid.
But won't the two ships collide?

Fields.DialogueText: I'm sure you feel that way, sir, but it's not your decision to make.
But what's life without a little stupidity, sir?
Oh, please, sir. I'll be piloting one, and I'll actually BE the other. It'll be fine.
Hm. Well, you'll just be putting your own fool self at risk, so I suppose it's fine.
Yay! I'm glad you feel that way, sir. I think.
*ALARM*
At your stations, sailors! We have Morganas inbound!
@BATTLE
What are you writing, Dunkerque?
I'm working on my application to compete in the Transpacific Yacht Race.
Application?
Well, I don't really have a track record of won races, so I'm writing a special application for them to let me in.

Fields.MenuText: How does that work?
Are you going to tell them you're a Belle?
Are essays commonly used in the yachting world?

Fields.DialogueText: If I can convince them that I deserve to be there, they'll let me compete in the race! I think.
Of course! Why wouldn't I?
Well, no, but these are special circumstances!
I figure they'll see the value of having a Belle in the race, on the off chance a Morgana shows up at some point.
Well, I'll let you get back to work–
*ALARM*
Speaking of work, eh?
@BATTLE
We're picking up a distress signal on the radio, sir!
Mayday! Mayday! We're under attack by Morganas! Cor, blimey, have they got us on the ropes...
Oh, they're British!
We have to come to their aid, regardless of their nationality, Dunkerque.
Are you kidding? I love the British!

Fields.MenuText: Really? That's not very French of you, Dunkerque.
That makes sense. In fact, you don't seem to really dislike anyone, honestly.
I didn't know anyone loved the British.

Fields.DialogueText: Maybe not, sir, but what can I say? We share a love of the sea.
Thank you, sir! I try not to.
That's not fair, sir. It's not their fault their food is what it is.
@BATTLE
Thanks, guv. You really saved our bacon back there.
Of course!
Now, who wants to crack open some of this ol' Scotch whisky?
I knew there was a reason I liked the British.
Oh, Capitaine!
What is it, Dunkerque?
I received a response to my application. Let's see... they want me to compete in a qualifier race!
Is that good news?
That's great news! This tournament is one of the premiere races in the world. Receiving an invitation is a great honor.
Then I suppose you should probably get a yacht.
Oh, I'll just modify one of the ship's boats.

Fields.MenuText: Excuse me?
Will that work?
I guess that's the economical choice.

Fields.DialogueText: You heard me!
You'd be surprised what a Belle in a boat can accomplish.
Yes. It's not like I can just steal a yacht from some rich playboy and claim it as my own, right?
*ALARM*
And I don't suppose the Morganas will have any yachts for the taking.
@BATTLE
Bonjour, Captain! You're looking formidable!
And you look excited, Dunkerque. Are you ready for the qualifier tomorrow?
Bien sûr, Capitaine.

Fields.MenuText: The ship's boat is all ready?
And you're still going through with this?
It's not too late to back out.

Fields.DialogueText: Yes, Captain. Laugh all you want, but I'm going to win that race!
Of course I am, sir.
Oh, but I wouldn't dream of it, sir.
The boat's ready, my crew's ready, and I'm going to down plenty of carbohydrates before I go to sleep tonight.
Why does this race mean so much to you?
I love the sea, sir. I love the feeling of the wind in my face, rippling waves extending as far as the eye can see. There's a freedom in the open ocean, sir.
You could go anywhere, and anything could happen. So, I'm happiest when I'm out sailing.
And, well... why should I be denied that just because I'm a Belle?
Fair enough, Dunkerque.
*ALARM*
Oh, those Morganas better not mess up my race!
@BATTLE
Nervous?
Not one bit!
Well, just try not to run into the ship.
Thanks, sir.
Oh, and Dunkerque? We're all rooting for you.
Thank you, sir.
Let the race begin!
(some time later)
Let's go folks! We've got to keep this boat moving!
I don't believe it...
I think she's going to win, sir!
Miss, er, Dunkerque has won the qualifier!

Fields.MenuText: Well, you didn't hit the ship.
I'm not sure I've ever seen a ship's boat move quite that fast.
Congratulations, Dunkerque! It looks like you really worked hard for this one.

Fields.DialogueText: No, haha, I guess I didn't.
Like I said, sir.
*Huff huff* Thank you, sir! Whew...
Don't get too caught up. We still have a job to do – a radio message just came in.
@BATTLE
For she's a jolly good fellow! For she's a jolly good fellow...
Oh, thank you all! Thank you so much!
We all know how much this tournament means to you.
So we thought we'd throw you a little party.
Ooh, I think I'll have to break out my stash for this...
What is that?
Jenever! It's Dutch gin.
That's a lot of gin...
*ALARM*
Looks like our party will have to wait a bit.
@BATTLE
So, so, so I say to Strasbourg... what did I say?

Fields.MenuText: I think you're drunk, Dunkerque.
Wow. That was a lot of gin. Wow. Wow.
Hahahaha...

Fields.DialogueText: It takes one to know one... sir.
Haha, yeah, it sure was, wasn't it?
Hahahaha!
You're quite the party animal, Dunkerque.
Parties are good for morale, sir. Never forget that.
Gahhhhhh...
Well, there you are, Dunkerque. I wasn't sure how long you were going to be out.
Do you have to speak so loudly, sir?
Oh, I'm sorry. Still, it's beautiful weather we're having today. Don't you think so?
Delightful.

Fields.MenuText: Say, you don't look too well.
You drank an astonishing amount of gin last night, Dunkerque. Straight. Straight gin!
How's the hangover?

Fields.DialogueText: Yeah... I'm aware.
Yo-ho-ho. Wait, does that mean I'm out?
I've been better.
Well, the cook has some bacon and eggs for you in the mess.
Really, sir? That might actually do me some good.
*ALARM*
Ow!
@BATTLE
Hey.
Oh, bonjour, sir. What are you up to?
Just making my rounds. How's the fishing?
There are all kinds of interesting fish in these waters. I'm enjoying myself.

Fields.MenuText: You know, Dunkerque, I think we might have gotten off on the wrong foot.
I'll be honest with you, Dunkerque. I misjudged you at first.
I need to apologize for how I treated you when we first met.

Fields.DialogueText: Never too late to fix one's footing, sir.
Maybe you did, sir. But maybe I misjudged you, too.
No, Capitaine. It's fine. Here's this crazy Belle, tossing tennis balls everywhere and talking about how she wants to compete in a sailing competition. I get it.
Honestly, this whole yacht endeavor has gone better than I thought it would.
It is a crazy plan, isn't it?
Want some jenever? Turns out I'm not out.
No thanks, I'm on the clock. Say, what were you saying about Strasbourg at your party? Who is that?
Oh, she's my sister. I love her, but... sometimes she gets on my nerves. She's always copying what I do.
Well, can you blame her, really? You've been a flagship and the lead member of the battleship line. That's pretty impressive.
Yeah, I guess...
You guess?
I... do you ever feel like you want something else out of life? More... freedom?
Perhaps... like a pirate?
I think I have a bite on my line.
Ha, good luck, Dunkerque.
@BATTLE
We're an hour out from port, sir.
Good. Don't let your guard down. Remember, we're not here on vacation.
Wait, we have visual contact!
Maybe it's a good thing we're here...
@BATTLE
It's finally time, sir. Time for the Transpacific Yacht Race!
Goodness. There are a lot of rich people here.
Maybe so, sir, but they're also my fellow competitors!

Fields.MenuText: I'll try not to hold it against them, then.
Do you think you'll be able to keep up?

Fields.DialogueText: Everyone's the same to the sea.
They're the ones who should be worried!
I think you might be right.
Sir, we're picking up some suspicious activity.
We'd better investigate it.
It would be just typical for those Morganas to show up and try to ruin a yacht race.

Fields.MenuText: I don't know. It seems almost cartoonishly villainous. What would they get out of it?
Yep. There seems to be no low they won't stoop to.
They could be looking to abduct one of these rich and presumably important people here.

Fields.DialogueText: Maybe spreading terror is enough for them.
I just hope they don't cost me the race!
That's a good point, sir.
*ALARM*
Looks like they have decided to make an appearance!
@BATTLE
Dunkerque, if Morganas decide to attack while you're racing...
I know, Capitaine. I'm not happy about it, but I'll do what needs to be done.
My priorities are in the right order. Besides, fighting Morganas is almost as much fun as yacht racing.
Welcome, Miss Dunkerque, to the Transpacific Yacht Race. I must say, your victory in the qualifier match was most... surprising.
Indeed! We've never seen anyone win with such an... unusual boat.
Well, what can I say? Unusual's practically my middle name.

Fields.MenuText: I thought it was "Adventure."
You can say that again...
I think they're being rude to you.

Fields.DialogueText: I can have two middle names!
I'm going to pretend I didn't hear that.
That's just how rich people talk.
There are quite a lot of... interesting people here.
The cream of the crop of the international yacht racing community.
Look! Over there! It's Sir Whaleford Chumpington, considered by many to be the greatest yachter in the world.
*ALARM*
We have Morganas inbound! Everyone, to your stations!
Oh my!
See? And you didn't want to let her in...
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
What? Now?!
No, this is a good thing. If we clear the Morganas away now, the odds of getting through the race without interference get a lot better.
... Merci, Capitaine.
@BATTLE
I'm worried about all these Morganas...
Breathe in... breathe out...
Are you ready? The race is about to begin.
Breathe in... Ready sir! Breathe out...

Fields.MenuText: Okay. I know at first I thought this whole yacht racing thing was silly, but you've come a long way. You've got this, Dunkerque.
Whatever happens, we're all proud of you. Myself, the officers, the crew – all of us.
Go get 'em.

Fields.DialogueText: Now, if I could convince you to fish more...
Thank you, sir. That means a lot to me.
Aye-aye, sir!
Racers! Ready! BEGIN!
LET'S GO!
Keep pace with that boat, sailors!
It looks like Dunkerque is making good time!
Maybe she has a chance in this?
I– I wouldn't be surprised, Lieutenant.
Uh, Captain?
What is it?
Morganas, sir.
Dunkerque! I know I suggested this might not happen, but....
I heard, sir!

Fields.MenuText: Duty calls!
Looks like you'll have to take a break from the race!
This shouldn't take too long!

Fields.DialogueText: Duty's pretty greedy with my time, if you ask me, sir!
I guess I am working up a bit of a sweat.
I sure hope not, sir!
@BATTLE
Okay, we took care of those Morganas.
Actually, sir, I don't think I lost too much time on that! Winning might be out of the question, but I can still get a good placement in the tournament.
Then let's go!
Oh no! Capitaine, we've just received word on the radio. The Morganas have abducted Sir Chumpington!
What?
Of course! That attack was a diversion! Sir Chumpington was all alone, in first place!
Hmm... I suppose being the finest yacht racer in the world probably would make him a valuable target for... something. Definitely doesn't have the finest name in the world, though.
They're making a break for it!

Fields.MenuText: Dunkerque... I'm sorry to say this, but I think we'll have to break from the race.
Duty calls! Again.
Want to meet the greatest yacht racer in the world?

Fields.DialogueText: *sigh* I know, sir.
I wish duty didn't have my number.
*sigh* I suppose it's my job, sir.
@BATTLE
He is very wealthy, at least.
Okay, I don't think I can place high enough to continue anymore, but I can at least finish the race in good time!
*ALARM*
Are you kidding me?

Fields.MenuText: Maybe the Morganas want to fight you because you're a Belle?
All these rich people in tiny boats? This place screams, "Attack me."
Maybe they just want you to lose the race.

Fields.DialogueText: That would at least explain why we never seem to be able to get rid of them.
Believe me, I've already thought of that.
I don't think even the Morganas are that petty.
@BATTLE
Well, that's taken care of. Time to limp to the finish.
Wait, what's that ahead?
It's the yacht racers!
They waited for you, Dunkerque. You won't have to finish by yourself.
My fellow competitors...
Let's go! We're not out of this yet!
She's neck-and-neck with the competition!
Come on, Dunkerque...
Captain!
Dunkerque! Look out!
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: Those damned Morganas!
They really know how to pick a bad time.

Fields.DialogueText: Ugh.
That's for sure.
And, in last place, Miss Dunkerque.
*sigh*
How are you feeling, Dunkerque?
Well, I didn't win. Or even place. Which, you'll understand, is disappointing.
But you did save all those people!
Yeah... I suppose.

Fields.MenuText: You might not have won the race, Dunkerque, but you accomplished some real good out there!
At least you know you're a good racer, even if you didn't win.
Who needs a dumb race. You've still got the open ocean! You still have your freedom!

Fields.DialogueText: You're right, sir.
I suppose, but I don't know if that makes it better or worse.
I guess, sir. As long as Morganas don't come along and ruin that, too.
*ALARM*
AGAIN!?
@BATTLE
DO YOU REALIZE HOW HARD I'VE WORKED TO GET HERE!?
Oh...
WHY? WHY WAS IT SO IMPORTANT TO YOU THAT I LOSE THIS RACE?
What's important is that you lose your LIFE. What better way to accomplish this than to attack while you race; when you are most distracted and vulnerable.
WELL YOU WERE WRONG!
*BOOM*
Dunkerque...
Yes, Capitaine?
We know how much that race meant to you, and how disappointed you were that it was ruined... so the crew and I cooked up something for you.
Here it is! A trophy, for you.
"Dunkerque, Number 1 Battleship." Oh, Capitaine... thank you, everyone. This is very sweet.
The yacht-racing world might not know you're the best, but we do.
I can't be upset about the tournament, knowing I have all of you to support me.

Fields.MenuText: You saved a lot of lives, Dunkerque. I'm proud of you.
You put your duty before your desire to win the race. I'm proud of you for doing that.
You never gave up on finishing that race. That's something you should be proud of. I know I am.

Fields.DialogueText: Thank you, sir.
I am, sir. Thank you.
Thank you all so much! I'm starting to tear up a little.
*ALARM*
Hehe... let's go take 'em on!
@BATTLE
Catch anything good today, Dunkerque?
Not yet, Capitaine. But it's still early! Who knows what I'll reel in next?
I'm glad to see you back to your cheery self.
Bah, it was just a tournament. Your trophy reminded me of what's really important.
That's very nice of you to say.
Besides, there's always next year.
*SPLASH*
Whoa!
Haha! Look at the size of this one! I hope you like fish, sir!
Hey, if you catch it, I'll eat it.
Great! I've got to go get this cleaned...

Fields.MenuText: She is quite the extraordinary woman. You know, I think I wouldn't mind if Dunkerque "caught" me...
I'm glad to see she's happy again. I just hope she doesn't make me go fishing again...
